title: Book Carrying Cabinet
text: Distinguished by its size, grain pattern, and beautifully restrained hardware, this book cabinet would have held books, stationary and writing implements necessary to a scholar. The handle indicates that it was intended to transport these materials out-of-doors when necessary. Reading and writing outside was a common literati pursuit.
description: huang hua-li book carrying case; double door, square hinges, handles and corner hardware; interior of three shelves and bank of three drawers slightly above center; decorative frame with handle similar to picnic boxes
creditline: Gift of Ruth and Bruce Dayton
